main event: Two pilots in an F-94 encountered a large, round white object with dim reddish-white lights while on routine patrol duty over Odessa, Washington on December 10, 1952.
interesting points: The object hovered, reversed direction almost instantaneously, and disappeared at a high altitude., Both visual and radar contacts lasted for 15 minutes but did not coincide., Initial hypotheses considered it a possible upper air research balloon, but there were no records of such objects in the area that day., Investigators later suggested that the sighted object could have been the star Sirius, causing anomalous radar returns due to atmospheric refraction., An attempt to contact local civil air authorities about the sighting was unsuccessful.
sighted object: a large round white object with reddish-white lights
